user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of add_response_entry_n:
```c
static bool
add_response_entry_n (struct MHD_Response *response,
                      enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                      const char *header,
                      size_t header_len,
                      const char *content,
                      size_t content_len)
{
  if (NULL == response)
    return false;
  if (0 == header_len)
    return false;
  if (0 == content_len)
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\t', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, ' ', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\r', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\n', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\r', content_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\n', content_len))
    return false;

  return MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_ (response, kind, header, header_len,
                                           content, content_len);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No unreachable code fragments found. Reasoning: every statement in the function is potentially reachable depending on inputs — the function consists only of a sequence of conditional checks that return false when true, followed by a final return that is reached only when none of the earlier conditions trigger. There are no unconditional returns that leave subsequent code unreachable, no constant expressions that always evaluate the same way, no always-false/always-true branches, and no dead branches or code after infinite loops. The memchr() calls are reachable whenever the corresponding length checks pass (header_len and content_len are non-zero). The final call to MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_() is reachable when none of the earlier guards return; thus there is no unreachable code to report for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.

Note: Although not related to Rule 2.1, the code does not check header or content pointers for NULL before calling memchr(), which could lead to undefined behavior if a NULL pointer is passed with a non-zero length. That issue is not classified as unreachable code and therefore is not included in the suspicious_frags list.
